factText: @DrPhil Can you offer any assistance to the victims of flooding in Midland,Michigan due to dam breaking.

"Edenville Dam, along the Tittabawassee River, failed on May 19 evening in wake of heavy rainfall in the days before. Nessel disputes claim that state litigation played role in Edenville Dam's failure https://t.co/3tDcBnDf8G
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_general_What misinformation or false reports are spreading about {event}?

factText: Please take note of this information if you plan to donate items to the flood relief effort.

Arenac, Gladwin and Saginaw counties added to flooding state of emergency. Trump Declares Emergency for Flooded Michigan Communities https://t.co/MLAjZ90mZv #theepochtimesnews #usnews https://t.co/Z3LiCBC1Nw. Ocean Sciences Article of the Day - Trump declares state of emergency as Michigan floodwaters recede (Reuters) https://t.co/5Llj7xbxc6. President Approves Emergency Declaration for Floods in Midland, Michigan https://t.co/2JVdXMkaCb @Flood_List

We are praying for all those in Midland and the Tri-cities region of Michigan where those living there have experienced such devastation as two breached dams have caused flooding. Southeast Wisconsin’s rivers and lakes are extra-full after heavy rain, but worst of flooding is over By: Sophie Carson, May 18 The slow-moving system that drenched southeast Wisconsin on Sunday lingered over the area Monday as flood-stage rivers crested and residents waited for the waters to retreat.
Sunday Update: Power restored; Flood warning remains in effect for Gladwin County

This past week, the Edenville and Sanford dams failed, releasing all 21 billion gallons of Wixom Lake into the village of Sanford and the city of Midland. Four months before the Edenville Dam failed, the state discovered the 96-year-old structure didn’t meet even state standards for its capacity to withstand major flooding, according to inspector emails. The Edenville Dam was under scrutiny for years by federal regulators who cited its insufficient spillway capacity, Detroit News said.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?

factText: President Trump says FEMA is in Michigan assisting with flood efforts https://t.co/Jmmoagt8Iu. I spent the day in Midland with my colleagues, Reps. Annette Glenn and Julie Alexander, helping with the clean-up efforts after the recent dam failures. Consumers Energy Foundation Provides Grants for Flood Relief. Our partners at 2-1-1 are working hard to assist everyone with their needs for this flood response.

To better assist the public as changes and road impacts continue to evolve, the Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) GIS Unit has developed an interactive map listing all road closures related to flooding impacting the region, primarily in Gladwin, Midland, and Saginaw counties. This geographic information system (GIS) map includes closures for state trunklines (I, M and US routes) and local roads, and will continue to provide updated road impacts until all flooding concerns subside.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_Flood_Which roads and bridges have been closed due to flooding?

factText: The sudden need to evacuate large numbers of people from severe flooding — also threatening to compromise a Dow chemical facility that uses a research reactor — during a time of national lockdown due to the Covid-19 pandemic, raises serious questions and concerns about the emergency response readiness and the viability of evacuation that might simultaneously include a radiological accident.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_Flood_What emergency measures are in place to prevent further flooding?

factText: Michigan floods expose impossible challenges of mass evacuations during Covid-19 By Paul Gunter Two dam failures and major flooding in central Michigan, which also prompted a low-level emergency notification (scroll to NCR event #54719) at a nearby nuclear research reactor in Midland, have exposed the almost impossible challenge of evacuating people to safety during simultaneous catastrophic events.
Impeach what about dams.
@2DianaAdams Thousands of people are now homeless because she caused the flooding.
**Important from Midland County 911 regarding Sanford and Wixom Lake areas** Even more roads are shut down today to keep onlookers away.

Federal regulators spent 20 years warning Michigan dam was in danger before it failed https://t.co/KXiBJbQaAG https://t.co/ZsXikM7YGz. Climate Change Raises Risk of Dam Failures (New York Times) https://t.co/McSNQUQ5UP. https://t.co/08AXMCqcXe
Feds spent 20 years warning Michigan dam was in danger before it failed
https://t.co/tCbqeK0DIQ. Michigan Flood Puts Privately Owned Dams in a Critical Spotlight https://t.co/qM11oTalXR

A catastrophic “500 Year Flood” has forced about 10,000 people in mid-Michigan to evacuate their homes after multiple dams were breached. 39-2020: Two Dams Fail in Michigan, Forcing Thousands to Evacuate Severe flooding struck central Michigan on Wednesday May 20th, 2020 after two dams were breached by rain-swollen waters, forcing the evacuation of thousands of residents and prompting officials to warn of life-threatening danger.
Video shows Edenville Dam as it breached in historic flooding https://t.co/WnP3ypW5UD

Volunteers needed in flood-damaged areas to help keep people 6' apart as they pull everything they own out to curbs Volunteers are being sought in Sanford and parts of Midland to walk around and remind people to stay six feet away from one another as they rummage through what remains of their earthly possessions.
The current list of items needed includes: ✅ Personal Protective Equipment ✅ Cleaning supplies ✅ Food ✅ Water ✅ Personal care items ✅ Household goods ❌

U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Detroit District, personnel are working in the Midland Emergency Operations Center with the County Emergency Management Team through the Memorial Day weekend in response to the dam failures in Michigan.

DNR Conservation Officers Evacuate People and Pets During Midland County Flood https://t.co/h5gbUNveqV. Michigan dam failures cause massive flooding and evacuations, May 19-20, 2020 https://t.co/ad1N6XmjyO. The failure of the dams forced 11,000 people to evacuate. State of emergency declared, 10,000 ordered to evacuate in Michigan after dams burst https://t.co/aiEhvKAkqR. Edenville Dam Fails, Residents Told to Evacuate https://t.co/OIsLlToMLj

If you are displaced due to flooding and need housing assistance, contact the American Red Cross at 425-595-2332. If you are displaced due to flooding and need housing assistance, contact the American Red Cross at 425-595-2332 Midland Fairgrounds campgrounds (located at 6905 Eastman Avenue) remains open to displaced families and camping fees have been waived. All who were in shelters have been placed in permit housing.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: FEMA has activated response efforts. Crews are working to restore temporary service and hope to have service restored to residences within the coming days. Sanford Hardware & Sians Recover from Dam Failures https://t.co/JuZ5ZfIldF
Saginaw County To Be Affected By Edenville Dam Failure https://t.co/fCRDRXqr7N
A total of 55 firefighters attended the scene.

As the river continues to recede, our focus shifts toward damage assessment, flood relief, and recovery. Midland Shelters for Flood Victims even under attack. Please join us in providing clean drinking water for those effected by the flooding in Midland, as well as the volunteers assisting in recovery efforts. Those impacted by the flooding in Midland, Michigan and the surrounding cities - relief is available for you!
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_Flood_Are there ongoing rescue operations for people trapped in floodwaters?

factText: The failure of the dams was expected to bring record-setting flooding, with the response complicated by the coronavirus. Michigan National Guard Responds to State of Emergency for Midland Floods https://t.co/XMl4yz9ecA. Whitmer Seeks Federal Aid in Midland County Flood https://t.co/eJq76okgfA
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_Flood_What is the government response to the flooding crisis?

factText: About 10,000 people were evacuating from Midland, and about 1,000 more residents in townships outside of the city were ordered to leave their homes, Bridgette Gransden, a Midland County spokeswoman, said in a telephone interview on Wednesday. In normal times, in such a scenario, the orders would come down for millions of coastal residents: Evacuate. People ask about how the Stay at Home order works when everyone's homes disappear.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: Because of this major event and for the public’s safety, we have been given permission by the Four Lakes Task Force to take any enforcement action necessary to stop people from trespassing in this disaster recovery area.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-013_general_What actions are being taken by law enforcement to ensure safety during {event}?
